text.section: An employment agency shall submit to the Commissioner a penal bond.

To ensure that each employment agency submits the penal bond in accordance with this section, the Commissioner may initiate an investigation or investigate a complaint that an employment agency has failed to submit a penal bond.

If, after investigation, the Commissioner finds that an employment agency has failed to submit a penal bond as required by this section, the Commissioner shall give written notice that directs the employment agency, within 15 days after receipt of the notice:
to submit the required bond; or
to show written cause why the employment agency is not required to comply with this section.

section.section:
If the employment agency complies with the requirement to submit a bond or otherwise submits a timely response, the Commissioner may:
terminate proceedings against the employment agency; or
schedule a hearing and, by certified mail, give the employment agency written notice of the date, place, and time of the hearing.

If the employment agency fails to comply with a lawful order of the Commissioner or fails to submit a timely response, the Commissioner may impose a civil penalty of not less than $500 and not more than $1,000 for each failure to comply with the order or failure to submit a timely report.

text.section: If after a hearing, the Commissioner finds that the employment agency has violated the provisions of this section, the Commissioner may impose a civil penalty of not less than $500 and not more than $1,000 for each violation of this section.
